definition: prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]

sentences.english: Canada is meanwhile getting older and its population is shifting westwards.
sentences.chinese: 加拿大面臨人口老齡化，人口重心也在西移。

sentences.english: The closer a society's population growth rate gets to zero, the more population aging it will be.
sentences.chinese: 一個社會的人口增加率越接近零，其人口便愈老齡化。

sentences.english: The aging trend will quicken in the next century.
sentences.chinese: 到下世紀初韓國人口老齡化進程將進一步加快。

sentences.english: Anti-aging in China has become a hot issue since it stepped into an aging society.
sentences.chinese: 我國已經進入老齡化社會，防衰抗老成爲研究的熱點。

sentences.english: As its demographics age, Europe will also struggle with the integration of immigrants.
sentences.chinese: 隨着人口的老齡化，歐洲也將面臨移民融合的問題。

sentences.english: Demographic change is another reason why the workforce is greying.
sentences.chinese: 人口變化是勞動力老齡化的又一原因。

sentences.english: The nearer a society approximates to zero population growth， the older its population is.
sentences.chinese: 一個社會的人口增長率越接近零，其人口便越老齡化。

sentences.english: Under the pressure of population aging, it is urgent to explore community old-age care system in Chongqing.
sentences.chinese: 重慶市在人口老齡化壓力下，探索社區養老日益迫切。

sentences.english: At the turn of the new country, our country has come into a society of old libation.
sentences.chinese: 在人類進入新世紀之際，我國也步入了老齡化社會。

sentences.english: He says the problems of an aging population represent only a mismatching or misalignment of the demand for goods.
sentences.chinese: 他說，人口老齡化問題僅代表對商品需求的錯位。

sentences.english: With industrial societies getting older the incidence of femoral fractures is increasing.
sentences.chinese: 隨着工業社會的老齡化，股骨骨折的發生率在增加。

sentences.english: What are the public health implications of global ageing?
sentences.chinese: 全球老齡化的公共衛含意是什生麼？

sentences.english: Hengyang city has gone into an aging society.
sentences.chinese: 衡陽市已進入老齡化社會。

sentences.english: China will have 25% of its population over 65 by 2050.
sentences.chinese: 到2050年中國將會有超過25%的老齡化人口。

sentences.english: Objective To study whether a physical cricopharyngeal bar is related to aging.
sentences.chinese: 目的研究器質性環嚥肌壓跡與老齡化是否有相關性。

sentences.english: The baby boomers may be aging but they still love to play.
sentences.chinese: 生育高峯的小孩正在老齡化，但是他們仍然熱愛活動。

definition: to intensify/to sharpen/to accelerate/to aggravate/to exacerbate/to embitter
lit. before it rains, bind around with silk (idiom, from Book of Songs 詩經|诗经); fig. to plan ahead/to prepare for a rainy day
